gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server
Class FerretTaskModule

java.lang.Object
  org.iges.anagram.AbstractModule
      gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server.FerretTaskModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Module
public class FerretTaskModule
extends AbstractModule

A task module to invokes Ferret as an external process. Modified from org.iges.grads.server.GradsTaskModule class.

Method Detail

getModuleID

public java.lang.String getModuleID()
Description copied from interface: Module
Returns an ID for this module. This ID should be a legal XML tag name. It has two uses: as a tag name in the server's configuration file, and as the final element of the complete module name.

Specified by:
getModuleID in interface Module
Specified by:
getModuleID in class AbstractModule

configure

public void configure(Setting setting)
               throws ConfigException
Description copied from class: AbstractModule
Configures the module according to the settings provided. The server supports dynamic reconfiguration. Thus this method may be called at any time in the life of the module. If the module cannot be reconfigured, it should throw an exception.

Specified by:
configure in interface Module
Specified by:
configure in class AbstractModule
Parameters:
setting - The settings to be used in configuring the module.
Throws:
ConfigException

                   throws ConfigException
Finds the Ferret binary according to provided setting

Parameters:
setting - setting tag that indicates the location of Ferret binary
Throws:
ConfigException - if the Ferret binary specified by setting does not exist

task

public Task task(java.lang.String taskName,
                 java.lang.String[] args,
                 java.lang.String envStr,
                 java.lang.String workDir)
          throws ModuleException
Generates a Task object for given task name and arguments

Parameters:
taskName - the jounal file name that will be run
args - an array of arguments to pass to the jounal file
envStr - a environment string that modifies the environment variables
workDir - a path that specifies what working directory the task should be executed
Returns:
a Task object for this task
Throws:
ModuleException - if the specified journal file does not exist.
